etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish عيناً (ʿaynen, “by eye, by sight, exactly, without difference”), from Arabic عَيْنًا (ʕaynan), adverbial accusative of عَيْن (ʕayn, “eye”). By surface analysis, aynı (“same”) + -en. Compare Azerbaijani eynən (“exactly”), Uzbek aynan (“exactly”) and Uyghur ئەينەن (eynen, “exactly”).
